## Uterine fibroid types

![](images/lm-mayo-types.png)

## Uterine fibroid types

::::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
![https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/uterine-fibroids/symptoms-causes/](images/lm-mayo-types.png){alt="https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/uterine-fibroids/symptoms-causes/"}
:::

::: {.column width="60%" .incremental}
#### FIGO Classification System

##### Submucosal Group

- Type 0: pedunculated intracavitary

- Type 1: \<50% intramural

- Type 2: ≥50% intramural

:::
:::::

## Uterine fibroid types

::::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
![https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/uterine-fibroids/symptoms-causes/](images/lm-mayo-types.png){alt="https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/uterine-fibroids/symptoms-causes/"}
:::

::: {.column width="60%" .incremental}
#### FIGO Classification System

##### Other Group

- Type 3: 100% intramural; contacts endometrium

- Type 4: intramural

- Type 5: subserosal ≥50% intramural

- Type 6: subserosal \<50% intramural

- Type 7: subserosal pedunculated

- Type 8: other, e.g. cervical, parasitic
:::
:::::
